page.title: 06 Gt Haseley Latchford Lane
page.content: We watched the builders and thatchers at work on the last house in Latchford Lane and then we walked up the lane counting the buildings.We counted 38 houses and bungalows before we reached the Church.We saw the Manor House and Manor Stables (now a house) and then came to Thame Road. The first house was once a shop and Lady Taylor's house used to be "The Crown" Public House.Around the corner into Rectory Road we saw the old Smithy,the forge and horses still there.Next door was the shop and bakery,now closed. We looked at Church Farm House with its painted imitation window and then saw the Granary at the Farm.The Old Rectory is next to the Village Hall,formerly Glebe Farm's Barn.Dames Bank was once a pub,The Six Bells. by Shane Smith.
